idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.3500

descript.abstract: United States ZIP Code (points) is a point theme representing the five-digit U.S. ZIP Code areas as points by placing their location using delivery-based centroids, plus all ZIP Codes that have no area and are represented as points rather than areas such as post office box ZIP Codes and unique ZIP Codes (single site, building, or organization). This dataset is a part of the 2010 ESRI Data & Maps collection.
descript.purpose: United States ZIP Code (points) provides the post office name, types, and area for each ZIP Code location in the United States.
descript.supplinf: Largest scale when displaying the data: 1:50,000. This dataset comes with an ESRI layer file symbolizing the features.

citeinfo.title: United States ZIP Code (points)
citeinfo.origin: Economic and Social Research Institute (Reston, Va.)

For other questions or comments, you may contact ESRI headquarters by e-mail, telephone, or fax or write to us.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata

cntorgp.cntorg: Research Data Services (RDS), Columbia University Libraries

enttyp.enttypd: The points represent areas where mail is delivered (from a city block or two to a whole rural town) such as Residential Post Office locations, Post Office box ZIP Codes, and unique ZIP Codes (for example, defining an organization) within the United States.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: The five-digit number used by the postal service to identify a location where mail is delivered.

codesetd.codesetn: USPS National 5-Digit ZIP Code and Post Office Directory

attr.attrdef: The five-digit ZIP Code of the area that encloses the ZIP Code point. To assign the enclosing ZIP, the actual location of the point is determined on a map. The boundary ZIP associated with the geographic location is the enclosing ZIP.

codesetd.codesetn: USPS National 5-Digit ZIP Code and Post Office Directory

attr.attrdef: The two-letter abbreviation for the state in which the ZIP Code point is located.

codesetd.codesetn: USPS National 5-Digit ZIP Code and Post Office Directory

attr.attrdef: The type of post office facility.
The FIPS code for the first county in which the ZIP Code is located.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Commerce, National Institute of Standards and Technology

codesetd.codesets: National Institute of Standards and Technology

attr.attrdef: The FIPS code for the second county in which the ZIP Code is located.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Commerce, National Institute of Standards and Technology

codesetd.codesets: National Institute of Standards and Technology

attr.attrdef: The FIPS code for the third county in which the ZIP Code is located.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Commerce, National Institute of Standards and Technology

codesetd.codesets: National Institute of Standards and Technology

attr.attrdef: The Residential Post Office (post office with mostly residential post office box customers) indicator.

edom.edomvd: This ZIP Code is a Residential Post Office.
This ZIP Code is not a Residential Post Office.

attr.attrdef: The 2010 estimated population of the ZIP Code area the point is based on.
The 2010 estimated population per square mile of the ZIP Code area the point is based on.

attrdomv.udom: Calculated populations per square mile for the features.

attr.attrdef: The area of the ZIP Code area the point is based on in square miles using Albers Equal Area Projection.

digtinfo.formspec: The SDC file contains the geospatial and attribute data. The SDI file contains the spatial index. The PRJ file contains the coordinate system information (optional). The XML file (*.sdc.xml) contains the metadata describing the data set (optional).

stdorder.ordering: ESRI Data & Maps is available only as part of ESRI software.

distinfo.techpreq: To use this data requires software that supports SDC files.

In the United States, contact the ESRI Telebusiness staff at 800-447-9778 for more information about our software and data.
Outside the United States, please direct all inquiries to your local ESRI Office. This information can be found at http://www.esri.com/company/locations.html.

citeinfo.title: Dynamap ZIP Code Boundary & Inventory Files, 2010

serinfo.sername: Tele Atlas Dynamap ZIP Code Boundary & Inventory Files

citeinfo.othercit:
Provides most of the attributes.
Product currentness date: April 2009.

srcinfo.srccitea: Tele Atlas Dynamap ZIP Code Boundary v. 17.1

procstep.procdesc: The following steps were performed by ESRI: Extracted data set from Tele Atlas MultiNet Post 2010.03. Removed unnecessary fields and reformatted the rest. Attached and formatted the fields from 2009 Data Update U.S. ZIP Code Points. Added the fields POP2010, POP10_SQMI, and SQMI by joining to Edition 10 U.S. ZIP Code Areas (Five-Digit) and calculating their values to "-99" where there were no matches. Converted the data set to SDC. Created ArcGIS layer file (.lyr), projection file (.prj), and spatial indices.

horizpa.horizpar: Horizontal positional accuracy is dependent on geographic area. In most areas, accuracy is between 5 and 25 meters (16 and 82 feet). In some areas, accuracy is off by up to several tens of meters (100 feet or more). In the poorest areas, accuracy is off by up to 100 meters (328 feet).

dataqual.logic: The shapefile is converted to SDC (Smart Data Compression) format using either tools in ArcGIS or ESRI SDC Data Development Kit Professional 2 (DDKP2). The SDC data set is then imported into a file geodatabase to verify and validate the geometry.
dataqual.complete: After processing, the data set is checked for drawing display and number of records and file sizes compared with source materials.
